alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 05 at 5:32PM CDT until June 05 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN DOUGLAS COUNTY... At 532 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in the Omaha metro area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in some areas. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the downtown Omaha area. Flash flooding is already occurring with numerous reports of flooded streets. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Southern Omaha, Ralston, Millard, La Vista, Aksarben, Benson, South Omaha, Midtown, Chalco and Zorinsky Lake. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
